climbs.name: Sand and Shadow on the Sea

content.description: Fun route right above the crashing water, start right at the water and work your way up the very obvious sand jugs, they seem pretty solid, and work your way up the rock face to the top for a view of the ocean!
content.location: Walk On Beach to the cliffs to your left, walk out and find the largest cliff, the face that looks towards the sea has the route.

content.description: Crouch/sit start in middle of face on sidepull and gaston and follow crack to horizontal, then up and slightly left.
content.protection: no pad or single pad enough as it is over sand :)
content.location:
Park at Walk-on Beach south of city of gualala. parking lot and follow signs. when you get to the ocean (5 minutes) turn left and walk a couple of minutes. Go down staircase to beach. boulder faces the ocean. Must climb at low tide. The day I did it it was a +1.0 foot low tide.

GPS for boulder: 38.7366103, -123.4936502

but it might be here (38.735974, -123.491891)--can't remember exactly it should be obvious based on the picture...
